page.title: 08H.GREEN & HAZLEMERE'S GHOSTS
page.content: A ghost story in Holmer Green states that every Thursday at midnight a carriage from the 17th century rides into the village pond.The only explanation known is that during the 17th century a rich and powerful family drove into Holmer Green their horse bucked and the carriage went flying into the pond.In the middle of the pond it is quick sand and the whole family drowned. In Hazlemere late one evening Mr.Farmborough and his friends were walking down Primrose Hill when they saw a procession of white objects go across the road straight in front of them .These objects were about a foot off the ground and about 3 and a half feet high.They looked around and nothing was there so they ran as fast as they could.
